title: Honoring Charles W. Kelly, legendary reporter, editor and publisher, upon the occasion of his retirement after 56 years of distinguished service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Charles W. Kelly, legendary reporter,
editor and publisher, upon the occasion of his retirement after 56 years
of distinguished service

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  acknowledge  the
significant  milestones  in  the distinguished careers of esteemed resi-
dents of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
Charles W. Kelly, legendary reporter, editor  and  publisher,  upon  the
occasion  of  his retirement after 56 years of distinguished service, to
be celebrated on Friday, September 10, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 56 years, Charles "Chuck"  Kelly  has  been  the
publisher  and  editor  of newspapers in Ogdensburg, Massena, Canton and
Malone; he has delivered more than his share of papers after  hours  and
on weekends when the delivery staff had gone home; and
  WHEREAS, After graduating from St. Mary's Academy in 1954, Chuck Kelly
worked  as a sportswriter and general assignment reporter before serving
a three-year stint in the United States  Army;  when  he  returned  from
overseas  duty  in  France  and Germany, he resumed working at the local
newspaper, rising through the ranks to become publisher; and
  WHEREAS, Chuck Kelly will retire as publisher and take on a  part-time
role with Johnson Newspaper Corporation's St. Lawrence County Newspapers
division, which includes THE JOURNAL AND ADVANCE NEWS in Ogdensburg, the
DAILY  COURIER-OBSERVER  in  Massena  and  THE  MALONE TELEGRAM; he will
continue writing his popular "Kelly's Comments" and "Glance at the Past"
columns in the ADVANCE NEWS; and
  WHEREAS, The words "Chuck Kelly" and "north  country  journalism"  are
synonymous;  his  opinions have long set the agenda for conversation and
debate throughout the region and whether you agreed with him or not,  he
would  always give you an open ear and fair shot; at the end of the day,
the things he cared most about were the newspaper he loved and the  city
he called home; and
  WHEREAS,  Chuck  Kelly  looks  forward to focusing on his column while
stepping back from the day-to-day  responsibilities  of  publishing;  he
takes  pride  in  the  quality of the newspaper's reporting and used his
role to help bring jobs to the area; and
  WHEREAS, Over the years, Mr. Kelly and others served on a committee to
help found the Ogdensburg Boys and Girls Club; he has  been  a  longtime
promoter  of  the  Ogdensburg  Volunteer Rescue Squad and volunteer fire
departments across the county; in 1959, he began chairing the Ogdensburg
Recreation Commission where it developed skating rinks on  Ogden  Street
and at St. Peter's Square and Winter Park; and
  WHEREAS,  Chuck Kelly mentioned he had always seen his role as someone
who forces a public discussion of the issues facing the community,  even
when elected officials might prefer to avoid it; and
  WHEREAS,  A  true  asset to society, Chuck Kelly has been a tremendous
source of support; his life story is a love  story  of  a  man  and  his
community; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout  has been his wife, Therese, who feels
privileged to be a part of his life and rejoices  in  his  achievements;
and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought  to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Charles  W. Kelly, legendary reporter, editor and publisher, upon
the occasion of his retirement after 56 years of distinguished  service,
and to wish him continued success in all of his future endeavors; and be
it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Charles W. Kelly.
